TextView.android:text: Feel tired after waking up?\n Here are tips that will change that:

1. Upgrade Bedding
 Invest in a supportive mattress and comfy bedding.


2. Darken the Room
 Block out excess light with curtains or a sleep mask.


3.Reduce Noise
 Keep noise to a minimum, use earplugs if needed.


4.Optimize Bedroom Temperature
 Set the thermostat to 65-68Â°F for a comfortable sleep.


5. Prioritize Seven Hours of Sleep
 Plan for at least seven hours of nightly sleep.


6. Stick to a Consistent Wake-Up Time
 Set a daily alarm for a steady wake-up routine.


7. Limit Naps to 20 Minutes
 Keep short, early afternoon naps.


8. Relax Before Bed
 Engage in calming activities 30 minutes before sleep.


9. Disconnect from Devices
 Avoid electronics an hour before bedtime.


10. Get Natural Light Exposure
 Spend 30 minutes outdoors or open windows for light.


11. Exercise Daily for 20 Minutes
 Incorporate daily, non-intense exercise.


12. Restrict Caffeine After 2 p.m.
 Limit caffeine intake after 2 p.m.


13. Be Mindful of Alcohol
 Avoid alcohol before bedtime.


14. Eat Dinner Early
 Finish dinner a few hours before bed.


15. Limit Nicotine and Smoke Exposure
 Minimize nicotine use and exposure to smoke.


16. Reserve Bed for Sleep Only
 Associate bed with sleep and intimacy.


17. Leave Bed After 20 Minutes
 Avoid frustration by getting up after 20 minutes.


18. Maintain a Sleep Diary
 Track sleep patterns and influencing factors.


19. Consider Sleep Supplements
 Consult a doctor for melatonin or other supplements.


20. Consult a Doctor
 Seek professional advice for persistent sleep issues.
